text: Visiting Charlotte for all the NASCAR nonsense, and a little southern city experience.  We arbitrarily decided to stop in for dinner with our daughter (7 months). After walking in realized not really the place to bring your kids. Staff was great, and made it work anyway.  I have a habit of always ordering a Black and Bleu burger if it is offered on the menu (or anything that is nearly the same), making my own comparison to others I've had. This was straight up the best I've had. Perfectly Medium-Rare, crumbly bleu cheese, and all the right trimmings.  All in all, the staff didn't have to be as great as they were (really could have just sent us on our way), and I was expecting okay at best bar food.

Civilized, respectable locations don't charge separate covers for the gander and the goose.  Yes, it's that simple.    Well, Ri-Ra, I used to be a fan of your Irish authenticity, in terms of a cozy, low-key beer every now and then.  But seems you have taken a turn away from legitimacy, and towards masses of drunken revelrers.  A shame, really, for my once favorite bar in Charlotte.

Granted time is of the essence, but the Staff at RiRa handled our group of 19 on a thirsty Thursday evening with ease!  Don't let uptown parking scare you away from crashing this party, with the Discovery Place parking deck just blocks away RiRa is very accessible for those not living Uptown.

RiRas is an excellent place to bring old friends to shoot the shit, eat by yourself or even have a few round of beers with your co-workers.  It's an Irish pub that serves really good food.  The decor is not too upscale, but it's also not a po-dunk place that you would be ashamed of using as a meeting place for someone new.    I had the traditional English breakfast which had some really nice and authentic black & white pudding while J-Dubs had a burger that was bigger than her face and needed 3 hands to grapple.  Needless to say, there was so much food that we ended up taking it back.  The important thing was that it was tasty.  They have a fine assortment of adult beverages as well.    Also the poutine is quite authentic from what I've been told, and it was the first time that I was able to try this Quebecois dish.  The gravy was savory and the cheese was decadent.  Some sprouts on top added a splash of color and irony.   Our waiter Ray was a cool dude, fresh out of Ireland, he was able to entertain and regale us throughout the night with his stories and random old-world European knowledge of this little former English colony of North Carolina.

Ri Ra is a great nightlife spot with lots of energy and a solid beer selection.  Always busy, but rarely slammed, this bar has several different areas to suit different tastes. Downstairs is usually more subdued with its true Irish-pub feel. Upstairs is dark and slightly clubby. Both offer live music that usually cuts off at a certain hour to let a DJ play (top 40s and fun classics- seldom electronic or techno). The best part though, is the porch, which offers a beautiful view of three Uptown giants surrounding the bar- Bank of America tower, Hearst Tower, and the Fifth Thirds building. When the weather is nice and you've got to be outside, you can't beat it.  And a tip for a busy night- use the bathrooms outside, they're always vacant.

Ri Ra is one of my favorite uptown bars to go to. It has a very earthy and relaxed atmosphere, often with Celtic playing in the air. The seats are comfortable and the old wood work is quite pleasing to the eye. Some of the bartender ladies have a slight Celtic accent, which can just make your heart melt.  I have never eaten here, so I can't speak as the quality of the food. Though from the looks of it, they food is made rather well. What I can speak of is their excellent array of whiskeys. Several great aged scotches and bourbons to choose from and some great beers to partner with.  Ri Ra is a great place to have a nice relaxing drink of whiskey and taken in a football (soccer) game.

I had such a blast at this place!  I went here with my boyfriend and a visiting friend, and we had a nice time.  It's your typical beer selection, and the irish ambiance is also typical, but nice.    We came in on a Thursday night (and did not have a cover).  We found a table with only two chairs, and one of the servers was quick to drag another over for us.    I don't recall it being smoky, plus my friend is a smoker, and she was going outside to smoke, so its either non-smoking or she was just being nice to us non-smokers.   The band we heard was great!  Loved the music they played, from 80s to bluegrass, and in some cases, a mixture of the two!  It's really loud, so if you are with your friends and want to chat, it's a bit difficult for that.  Overall, a good time.  Good people, good music, and good beer.

Ri-Ra's is an Irish Pub and Restaurant that becomes a popular nightlife spot in Uptown Charlotte after dinner hours.  The food is good for the price level, and eating on the 2nd floor patio which looks onto the Hearst  plaza is a great experience during the warmer months.  At night Ri-Ra's has live music and a DJ which alternate floors depending on the night.  The bartenders are excellent, the atmosphere fun, and the drinks strong.  A great place to go to have a few drinks with drink specials every night of the week and a great place to grab a meal with specials depending on the time of day.  Cover for guys is $5 on the weekends, free for girls.

Went here during speed street for a drink with some friends so it was likely not a typical night, but we had a great time. The ambiance upstairs was great though the cover band was loud so we chose to sit outside. The balcony had a decent view and  it was a bit smoky but not too unbearable (and I'm the kind of guy who doesn't usually mind it).  Everyone I saw seemed to be having a good time, which is always a great sign, and if I lived in Charlotte I'm pretty certain I'd be here regularly.
Awesome authentic Irish bar..very warm. And welcoming wait staff. I had the lamb stew and it was the most tender lamb I had in a long time . If I come to Charlotte again am back here.

Have been to Ri Ra's a few times. The food is good and they have an extensive list of beers on tap. The service leaves something to be desired especially at dinner but bartenders are friendly if you prefer to sit at the bar.  The half priced apps happy hour on weekdays is great.

Cute pub, good food-- crappy, inattentive service.. I truly am not impressed when a server takes my order yet refuses to write the order down.. esp when my order comes out all wrong. What does impress me is when a server actually does record my order, and everything comes out how I ordered it... Tonight I had a fairly simple order however I asked for salad dressing on the side.. Low and behold, my salad came out slathered with dressing. My boyfriend asked for sweet potato fries yet was delivered regular fries as a side. Aside from that, our server failed to ask if we wanted another round of drinks, yet when he finally did ask, our second order of drinks came out 10 minutes later. What truly was upsetting was that the bartenders were too preoccupied with the televised soccer game to help out the server. Crappy service = crappy tip and a crappy yelp review. Try again fellas.

I visited here last year and had the time of my life. Talked to one of the best waitresses in the world, Mairead. She's from Cork, as is my father's grandfather. (Yes, I was wearing a red shirt for Cork!)  If you have any appreciation for the Irish and our wonderful food, you owe it to yourself to visit.

The food was good, but there were 3 kids who were allowed to run around. The parents and  management seemed to be oblivious to the action of the kids. One of the waiters had stop so that he wouldn't drop the large platter of food!! The wait staff was not that great either!
Love the beer.  Good service and wide beer selection.  Great place to meet after work for a few drinks to catch up with friends and coworkers.

We visited this pub on our first trip to Charlotte. The Guinness Stew and Potato Cakes were very tasty. Our server was friendly and fast. Our beers were never empty before we had a refill. Great place!

Went for lunch with a group of girls from work. Waitress was completely overwhelmed. She had too many tables and I didn't see a manager out helping her once. We ordered our food at 12:15 and asked where our food was 12:45. Didn't get our food until after 1. I had a meeting and told the waitress to nix my order. She came out with orders and dropped the tray as she was handing out food. 2 people didn't get their food and the other 4 had to get to go boxes. Food isn't good either. Changes need to be made. I have never had a good experience here.

I have never been treated so disrespectfully at an establishment. I have been to Ri Ras a couple times, each time the bar tenders were so rude. Despite people standing at the bar wanting drinks, they bartenders stood there and chatted ignoring everyone. When I finally got their attention, they acted like making a drink for me was outside of their job description. Even the door man commented on how rude the bartenders were. Never going back.
The Whiskey Room atmosphere is wonderful. Ask for Ray or Adam; I got an education on Irish whiskey tonight and they won't steer you wrong.

I am so upset and disappointed.  We've been here several times and always enjoyed ourselves.  After our experience Friday night, we will never darken the doors of Ri-Ra again.  Our waiter got my husband's drink wrong.  He never came to see how were doing, to re-fill our drinks.  I had to flag the manager down to ask for mustard and ketchup for the burger.  The waiter can't use the excuse he was busy, because he checked on the table  behind ours FOUR TIMES while we never got any attention.  The couple next to us left because they never got waited on and looked really irritated, understandably!    How hard is it to mess up a cheeseburger?  That was one of the WORST burgers I've ever had.  No flavor.  Terrible.  When my husband tried to complain about the lack of service, the waiter got an attitude and was all defensive.  The manager didn't really seem to care.    You've lost a customer, Ri-Ra, and I think we deserved better.

Ordered food from brunch menu to find out after half an hour that they are not serving brunch. The reason the brunch menu is new and shouldn't have been out until next week. Well we had food from the same menu two months ago.

I went back to RiRa's for lunch today and sat on their rooftop terrace to enjoy the gorgeous weather.  I ordered the hummus wrap with the vegetable stack.  It was delicious!    They also had a breakfast/brunch menu.  My husband ordered an omlette with brisket.  He commented on the fresh eggs and cheese but said the brisket was the star of the show.  He was pleased that the brisket was mixed into the omlette not just folded over the ingredients.  The omlette came with potatoes and a thick cut of toast perfectly toasted.  I mean where else can you get brunch severed with such a great beer selection?!

After a reservation snafu, which management promptly corrected, my wife and I had a great time at RiRa's.  They had some very creative small plate offerings, partnered together with some very solid traditional Irish fare.  There is certainly something here for everyone. The restaurant/pub has a lot of charm to it, and you can definitely tell the folks who run this place take great pride in caring for their customers and representing their heritage in the food they serve.  My wife and I real liked the fried Ruben sliders, the shepherds pie, and the potato and leak pancake chicken wrap.  I look forward to coming back.

Great food. I had the hooley kebab for dinner. It was on the lunch menu but they still let me order it. Huge portion. Tasted my dads lamb stew and loved it! It was trivia night so winning 50 bones certainly helped w that 5th star;)
Aside from the sweet potato fries, the dubliner was awesome (I love lamb meat)
Great food and great drinks, but avoid this place on the weekends. It changes from an Irish pub to a douchebag magnet club with ridiculously loud hip hop and Pop 40 music .

Good Irish breakfast.  Even though this is chain, there are staff from Erin who are happy to serve you.  The Guinness is good and the craic is better when with friends.  Only complaint is that I think they deep fry the white and black pudding which is a no-no...
I went here one morning in search of a proper fry-up.  It was okay.  The service was pretty good; but, the bangers could be a little better.

Today was my first time eating there and I was a little disappointed about the service.   I ordered the soup of the day and was told it would be potato leek soup. The food came quick but no potato soup. Instead I got a chicken chilly soup and was told they had no potato soup. I would have liked him to tell me before instead of just bringing something else that I might not even like without even asking me if it was ok or if I would like to order something else.   The food was ok but the soup wasn't really an appropriate portion for its price after already getting something else than I expected.   The service itself wasn't to great either. We had a group of people and you would expect him to take everyone's order at the same time but everyone had to call him individually to place a food order which caused everyone to eat at a different time and in the end people still didn't get their food until we almost had to leave again.

Awesome food awesome drink specials awesome wait staff 5 out of 5 place is incredible casual pub downstairs more upscale upstairs great bars giant patio love the place you always see a friendly manager who never fails to stop and check in with each table to make sure everything is perfect and if it isn't they absolutely make it right... Crazy good Guinness Sundae for dessert as well!!! Try it if you haven't!!

Rí Rá is so great and so lackluster at the same time.  If it's late...if it's a weekend...prepare to pay a cover.  IMO, an Irish pub shouldn't be the type of place to attract crowds that pay cover charges.  This actually destroys any cred that I'd give to an Irish pub in the first place.  Disappointing!  The decor...the interior...the layout...pretty damn nice.  The bar and layout is exacty what I expect from a traditional Irish pub.  For a narrow layout anyhow.  The bar itself is about as authentic as you can get.  Very nice!  The atmosphere is nice when you're here early and bellied-up.  The patio is also nice for enjoying the evening.  Weekend nights...just say no!  The crowd is a grab-bag of disappointment.  Which leaves us with the food...it's food.  If it's late...and you paid the cover...and you're hungry...go ahead.  If you're not at Rí Rá, and you're hungry...there are many other fine options.  Try: Some Tullamore Dew neat  Avoid: Weekend nights

Was visiting from Chicago and this place rivals any of the best Irish pubs out there. The ambiance is great, with the traditional wood paneling everywhere. Plenty of tvs for us to watch the games. We came in for a late brunch and it's was so delicious. My coffee came in it's own French press (which I will now buy for myself) and the breakfast sandwich had bangers, ham, cheese, bacon and egg on a toasted brioche bun. I made everyone at the table try it! If I ever happen to be in Charlotte again, I won't move from that bar. Haha better than epicenter!

Stopped in after the theater for a pint, but could not get served. We sat down at one of the tables ( more or less stood by it because it needed cleaning) & waited for a server. One did walk by our table to grab the tip from the table behind us, then walked back by our table, but we were invisible. I then asked the bartender if we needed to place our order with her & take it back to the table, but she said servers were on the floor & they would take our order. So, we again waited & never did see a server. We gave up & went elsewhere for our nightcap.
One of my first experiences in uptown when I moved here...what a great Irish pub not to mention the food is out of this world...definitely recommend

The bartenders will try to rip you off. Paid $6 for all tonic that was supposed to have gin in it. No alcohol at all. Happened to a friend in the same night as well. When he asked the bartender to make a real drink he had an attitude and did it reluctantly. About an hour later the same thing happened to me. All tonic, no gin. Waste of $6. Politely asked the bartender to make a new drink worth the price. The bartender rambled on about how it was too bad and the sale was final. He made $12 off of about $0.50 of tonic and no alcohol. Completely rude and unapologetic. Thinking they could take advantage of people who have been drinking already. Unless you feel like throwing away your money, there are much better bars that actually care about the customer experience.

The food is typically very good.  However, the menu was recently changed significantly reducing menu options including the elimination the best item on the menu - Guinness stew.    How does an Irish bar eliminate Guinness. Stew???  Know your customers, bring back the stew.
The large employee guy with blonde hair was belligerent and trying to start fights with several us last night. He needs to be fired and needs to be some changes made.

Been here twice; both times it was an awful experience. In both cases, the trouble started with the hostess, continued through poor/nonexistent service. On this occasion, there was a cover for the privilege of listening to a lousy cover band playing tired seventies tunes in a room with terrible acoustics--apparently without a soundboard--and putting down money on overpriced drinks, surrounded by frat boys, guidos, and gold diggers in addition to the aforementioned problems. I'd write a more entertaining review, but honestly it's not worth the effort.

I went to Ri Ra a few weeks ago and had a great experience. I called ahead to make sure they were serving fish and chips that day (they only serve it if the catch of the day is up to their standards) and they were. The beer selection is really great-- we decided to get the trio of Irish beers featuring Harp, Swithwicks, and Guinness.  We started out with a half order of wings with a Jameson honey glaze. The wings were perfectly cooked and the glaze was really excellent. My boyfriend and I both ordered the fish and chips which were fresh and delicious with a crisp and delicious crust. Even though we were incredibly full, we saw the table next to us order a dish full of what looked like chocolate mousse and immediately told our waitress we wanted that for dessert. It was a Bailey's chocolate mousse with whipped cream on the top. It was a HUGE serving, perfect for sharing and definitely fulfilled our chocolate craving. In addition to the food, the atmosphere was really cool and the service was fantastic. Our waitress had a lot of great suggestions and seemed very knowledgeable of the menu.   I will be heading back to Ri Ra very soon to try some Guinness stew or a traditional Irish breakfast!

Went with my husband for dinner once and the food was okay. I got a steak with some kind of whiskey sauce it was decent. The potato cakes were good.   As for the nightlife it's okay when it's not packed but once it's full it's hard to get around because the room is so small. Drinks are okay if you can get someone's attention at the bar, or even get to the bar in the first place.  Service is usually pretty good - when it's busy they're a little harder to get ahold of.   Last time I went for lunch my only complaint was they kept the door to the outside open and the sun was shining right in my face.   All in all it's ok, but not the best or most authentic Irish Pub I've been to. After all I am weighing it against Boston pubs...
I came here alone on a Tuesday night and had the Shepherd's pie and Harpoon special which was $4 a glass. The beer was good and food delicious.   It was fairly cost effective for the area as well.

I honestly can say that I have found my lunch spot. I tried them out a couple of times and the sandwiches and wraps have been nothing but exceptionally delicious. They have so many different sandwich, wraps, and salad options. My favorite item on the menu so fast has got to be the honey mustard grilled chicken spinach wrap. I highly recommend this place for your lunch option. It also doesn't hurt that they are literally right next door to my work so I don't have to walk far.

I went to Ri Ra recently on a Friday night for a coworkers going away shindig.  I had a really good time.  I enjoyed the dark cave like old time bar aesthetic.  The had some diverse options on tap.  In the downstairs area there was some live acoustic guitar/singer.  Upstairs consisted of a DJ and lights - playing standard top hits.  There is a deck off the 2nd floor that was pretty popular the night I was there - a nice respite from the noise inside.

Your mom may or may not like this place. Bring a flash light! Guinness barbecue sauce was the shizzle. So were the wings. Wife ended up getting all banged up on some concoction of fireball and sparkling wine......pfffft, light weight.

Good dinner and lunch menu food.  I'd call it authentic Irish pub fare, but then again, I've yet to visit the Emerald Isle, so what the hell do I know?  Other food, namely from the little side sandwich area, is not so good.  The Ri Ra sandwich shop is convenient for most bankers who work uptown, but convenience is all it has going for it.  The sandwiches are overpriced, VERY slim on the stuffings (meat and cheese that is...they will give you all the shredded lettuce your little heart desires...yay).  And to top it off, their seemingly extensive chalkboard of sandwich fixings is paired down by about 50% on any given day, due to them being out of stuff.  Skip the sandwich shop and go to the upstairs balcony for lunch outdoors when it is nice.  You can get their sheperds pie (really good) for the price of one of their sandwich combos (really crappy).  Ho-Hum bar experience...during peak times, can get annoyingly hard to get a drink/have a conversation/breath downstairs, but you are in Uptown.  What do you expect?  It's somewhat better than the offerings of the Epicenter, but not by much.

My last visit to Ri-Ra was sub-par to say the least. We sat at the bar because we were just grabbing a quick lunch and it took forever to just get our order taken. We both had burgers and it seemed like they had to go kill the cow to get the meat because it took so long to get them out to us. My friend's burger was very undercooked and both of our fries were COLD. I would not suggest this place if you are looking for a good lunch!!

Ri-Ra's is an Irish pup, not a stereotypical Chinese man saying "We Lost".  On weekend's they'll have a cover, but this is offset by the lack of a bathroom attendant, so the overhead expense for going out here is in line with the rest of downtown Charlotte.  The prices of drinks are probably a bit higher here, so you may wish to get a base going before you find yourself here.  The bartender was pretty nice to me.  I used an iPhone app with a drink database to order a random obscure cocktail and "Irish Twist".  She had no idea what it was but made it for me using the iPhone recipe, injecting some uniqueness into my Ri-Ra's experience.  And it may have just been the Irish Twists handling my perceptions, but I'm pretty sure she liked me.

Food- 4.25 Service- 1.00 We had a reservation for 12 for a casual business dinner. It was moderately busy-- a few open tables. It took 45 minutes to get our server to take our dinner order. It was very difficult to get our server's attention throughout the evening. We waited on drinks so long that we ended up re-ordering from the bartender. One person from the group re-ordered her drink twice and never received it. Really bad service, which is unfortunate because we really like to award good service!  The food, once it came, was excellent. Everyone was happy with their order- flavor, portions, offerings.  Sadly the service (or lack thereof) means we won't be bringing our big groups back here. It really seemed like the server was out of her element.   Update: a member of my party shared the experience with a manager and she adjusted the bill to compensate for the service. That earns an additional star from me.
food--- great    booze----great   service-- great  if you do not like this place , see a therapist.

This week's Excited about Eating is headed to Uptown Charlotte to visit Ri Ra Irish Pub. When we walked into this restaurant, it felt like we were walking into a pub in Ireland. Our server told us that the interior was transported from Ireland and restored into its existing condition.  We started with the Potato Cake appetizer, pan seared potato and cheddar cakes served with savory sour cream and a balsamic reduction. The Potato Cake was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. On the downside, it was loaded with onions and only served lukewarm. Dora here, Good thing we didn't stop there. :)  I ordered the Shepherd's Pie, made with minced lamb, gravy, peas, carrots, and leeks served with a mashed potato crust and a slice of brown bread. The term "shepherd's pie" is used when the meat is lamb; the theory being that shepherd is connected to sheep and not cattle. This was an outstanding dish. The lamb and vegetables were perfectly cooked and full of favor with just the right amount of liquid, and the mashed potatoes were creamy with a nice crust. Dora here, I'm always game for Shepherd's Pie, and this was the first I've tasted with lamb. Thankfully, hubby shared with me or I might've resorted to stealing his fork. Soooo good!   My wife chose the Ri Ra Burger, topped with Ashe County cheddar, country ham, brown sugar onions and a Brioche bun. This burger was tall, juicy, and almost too big for the mouth. The caramelized brown sugar onions were sweet, and the garlic mayo added a unique taste. The "Chipper " chips are actually thick cut fries. I snagged a few and enjoyed dipping them in the garlic mayo. Dora here, This was a messy burger, but oh so yummalicious! And I probably drank a gallon of their iced tea.  I would rate this establishment 5 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving outstanding food. If I included the less-than-thrilling appetizer, I'd lower my rating to 4 forks.  ~Ernie Hiers, Food blogger at Fiction Faith & Foodies

Horrible service from the missing hostess to the unavailable server to the b*tch of a manager. Ordered a burger. Took 30 minutes to get it and then it came out wrong. No apology, no assistance. They wouldn't even leave me the fries to munch on. Worst pub experience I've EVER had!!! Went to enjoy the Euro, left completely disappointed and will not return. Contacting the home office of this chain...

Great irish pub. Interior is great, looks like an authentic pub. They've got great food. Service is pretty good as well. Like most bars in Charlotte it's filled with smokers but that's par for the course in NC. Two levels, downstairs looks more the irish pub part. They typically have entertainment in some form either upstairs or down. Definitely worth a stop for a pint of Guinness!

Here's a big hint: on Mondays, the burgers are half priced if you eat in!  They grind their meat in house so you can get them as rare as you like.  I strongly recommend getting the hand cut chips, they are light years better than the regular fries.  The burgers are huge, crumbly and messy, like a good hand made burger should be and they have a few different kinds, a friend had the lamb burger and said it was outstanding.

Good food, good service, good brew, and a very low-key place.  Had lunch with some friends and family recently and I would really recommend the chicken pot pie.  It was very tasty.  The Irish lamb stew was also pretty good, but the Rueben sandwich was just average.  After a couple of pints of Guinness everything was alright with the world.  We would all go back because it was our kind of casual place.

I'm visiting from New Jersey with one of my friends. We walked in and waited to be sat. No one came or even looked at us. We decided to sit at the bar. The bartender looked at us walked away. I assumed he would come back after helping another person at the bar. After 10 minutes he never returned. In the mean time a waitress also saw us sitting there politely ignoring us still. Drink less food less. Needless to say the RI Ra in Atlantic City is way better. When I come back to Charlotte I won't be trying this restaurant again.

Ri Ra is a pretty good size Irish pub in the First Ward downtown Charlotte. I stopped in for a quick solo lunch and was surprised to see so many free tables. If Ri Ra was near my office in Chicago, it would be packed at lunch time.   The hostess and server were both extremely nice. The hostess told me that all the wood and furnishings were brought over from Ireland when Ri Ra was built. It's a pretty big place, 2 floors, with a large bar and lots of tables.   I was craving a burger but I had been told that I should have brisket while in Charlotte. Since I always do what I'm told, I went with the Wiltshire Patty, a delicious brisket sandwich. The brisket was very good, but the sweet potato tater tots were even better. Sweet potato tater tots. I'm now on a mission to find some of these in Chicago.   Friendly service and sweet potato tater tots, what more can you ask for?
The bar is attractive.  The beer is cold.  The fish and chips ranks right up there with Mrs. Paul's

Yes, you have to pay a five dollar cover.  Yes, that's super lame.   The band was awesome and the bartenders were amiable and generous.  It was crowded, but I didn't have any problem getting service from the bar.  The smokiness definitely didn't bother me because I'm used to Mississippi bars which are much worse.  It seems like this is where the younger crowd hangs out.  I certainly enjoyed myself.  Ri Ra Rocks.    Apparently it's cool to wear a Christmas sweater too.  Do it.

It really doesn't matter if you are coming to eat, happy hour, meet up before going out or hitting this place late night Ri Ra is a great spot in Charlotte. Right down town and close to night life and the professional sector. I eat here often and I have yet to have a bad experience. Brunch here is amazing, as well as lunch and dinner. The bar tenders are really attentive and the drinks are well priced. Go here and you won't regret it!
The inside bar is tastefully done and still holds strong to the Irish theme. The best spot for a quiet rooftop drink without a ton of people.

When I walked into this place I felt like I was walking into my dad's favorite bar in my hometown.  It was very casual and laid back, with the big wooden chairs and comfortable atmosphere.  The food was about the same as the bar back home too.   Good but not spectacular.  It tasted very fresh and well cooked, but pub food is rarely worth getting too excited about.  The waitress was very attentive and took good care of us.  She really wanted us to have a good time.

I see a lot of people complaining about how smokey the place was, which is ironic because it burned down. It will reopen "as soon as possible", although they don't seem to be rushing it; the fire was in May 2009, and there is talk of a Reopening Party in the summer of 2010.

I've been to Ri Ra more times than I can count. It is a great place to go have a pint of Guinness with some friends and some pretty decent food if you are in the mood. The inside is very dim/dark lit and that added to all of the wood used everywhere to both decorate the bar, walls, tables makes it feel very much "pub" like.   While they do try and sell the traditional irish fair of Fish and Chips, Shepards pie and such I gotta admit that as much as I like this place the food could be a little better. It just feels like for the dollar amount you have to put forth (usually are 20$ a plate for dinner) you would be getting a little better quality. Also, the drafts of Guinness run at around $5.25 a piece so they are for sure running at premium price. Still though, despite its few shortcomings I would always recommend this place for a chill place to hang out and have some Guinness.

My husband and I decided to give a try to Rí Rá. Ambience was cool. We had a conversation without yelling!! We ordered fish and chips, and chicken tenders. Waiter was ok. They have different promotions for every day. Live music Fridays and I think Saturday. (From 10 pm).

So a lucky trip to Charlotte allowed me to find this little joint.....and I'm glad that if did. Remember....Customer Service, Quality, Cost.   We were quickly greeted by a genuinely friendly hostess. I love people who are really happy to see you. Fake smiles.....well anyway....hostess was very nice and friendly. Sat quickly with a great view....the bar. The selection of beer and spirits is pretty good. Prices were fair for market location.   Our server, Lovely, was great. Yep that's her name. She Listened to us. Answered questions and was prompt. So great on customer service.   The food was excellent. I had the Irish Curry Chicken and the better half had Fish and chips. Portions were more than adequate. Taste was very nice with great flavors. We both had a few drinks and those were swell. So good on quality.   The prices were very reasonable for being downtown Charlotte. Very pleased. The whiskey list had some good choices with a few that I felt over priced, but that is my opinion.   So over all I give 4 stars. Would have been 5 but I didn't see anywhere that said it was kind of a sports bar. Soccer was on and a few patrons were overly excited causing a little more noise than I would like when dining. A little sign might help just prepare my brain. Otherwise great job.   BTW. We got a 10% discount for going to the Spectrum Center tonight to see Bruno. Bonus!!   Cheers! Or should I say Slainte!

Super friendly Irish pub that KNOWS how to pour a Guiness. The place was jumping when I got there. They have a good happy hour, though I didnt eat there they seemed to have a very extensive menu and the guy next to me was eating something like a shepards pie. All in all I would recommend this place.

Our group was in Charlotte for a conference and came upon this bar. The first night, we drank our weight and had a great time. The atmosphere was typical for an Irish bar, and we found the staff friendly and amazingly quick for as busy as it was. Two nights later, we came back for dinner. The right of us all loved our meals. The shepard pie was especially good and the sweet potato tater tots with a side of Guinness bbq sauce was a hit with entire table. We will most likely be back here again this week.
Simply awsome!  Great atmosphere great people. Great food.  Highly recommended.  A true irish pub in charlotte

My night started with being surrounded by a group of college women (I'm just itching to call it a "scrunchie", like one would refer to a *colony* of ants, a *pack* of coyotes, a *gaggle* of geese, or a *screetch* of hens -- Ok, so I made that last one up.  I dare you to spend three minutes waiting for a traffic light to change near these folks without seeing where I'm coming from.) discussing loudly just how "ratchet" they wanted to get.  (Seriously - first time I've heard the term used un-ironically. Ugh.)   My silent prayers were answered when none of the nearby spots they discussed plans to boot in the near future included Ri Ra.  Don't know, don't care where they wound up (bless the single [if that many] beating hearts among 'em. [Yeah, I meant it that way - this was one creepy belligerent Borg-like group of sisters]); but my visit to Ri Ra was a definite success. Service was fairly efficient, the food was fairly good (my main complaint is that sides weren't seasoned (even salt and pepper) and chips could have benefited from a few more minutes in the fryer.  But "Authentic Irish fare" - no.  Really, no.  Irish-ish, yes.  Definitely.  But  there are too many nods to American chain cuisine to merit equating this to what one would find in Ireland, having spent a few months there.  In the "win" column: drafts were good and well-served, though mostly not particularly Irish (not a complaint, just reinforcing that 'authentic' is not the best word to use to describe this place accurately.  Fair to good selection / variety.  And the setup is fairly good, even for nights when they're packed.  Fair mix of tables and bar seats & service, with a decent amount of floor-space for when they're busy.  The house ground burger was great - good mix of fat and lean, good grind size. The kitchen makes one hell of an egg.  And that's no small thing, especially in a pub / bar, which means the usual service hand-offs and oddness.  The malt vinegar mayo should be on the menu - it saved the otherwise fairly blah (undercooked) chips.  The fish and chips, though, falls on the other side of the ledger. Fries were blah, as above, and fish was unbelievably unseasoned, and overcooked.  No one likes chewy, fishy fish.  I was a little puzzled by the two glasses of white zin that were perched on the back of the bar for several of my visits (which each lasted several hours)...Odd.

I used to work at Ri Ra's and most of the time that generates a horrible review - however, I loved this place. The food was always good quality and kitchen staff was awesome.  The selection of import beer was good and the bartenders could make up some crazy concoctions. I always had a blast working on the weekends cuz the crowd was fun, the music good, and the tips = phenomenal! One hint: if you don't want to wait 30 minutes to get a drink from the bartender then snatch up a cocktail waitress and they'll get in bout 5 minutes. Allow time for them to fight the crowd to and from the bar and you'll have your drink in no time. And yes - a tip is appreciated.  Anyhow! A little history about that bar that I learned while working there: everything downstairs is imported from Ireland. The owners have a partner over there who does nothing but look for antique stuff for ambiance. Ask you server the next time you dine downstairs about some of the artifacts. It's actually pretty impressive.  Oh! And if you get a chance to dine outside on the patio take it! It's always comfortable and has a seperate restroom out there which is nice since there's not an abundance of restrooms.

Overall a decent a irish experience. The landscape is a little confused and varies night to night. Sometimes it's a fratty hang out, sometimes and emo rocker feel, at times casual dining, and sometimes (be it rare) a dance party.  the food is run of the mill. the drinks are solid.  BUT I do love the balcony with a great  ant's eye view of the city. Look straight up and see the best buildings in Charlotte and a great night sky.
From a bar perspective, it's kind of a 'bro down' similar to most bars in central uptown.  I can't speak to the food, but I've heard good things.

We decided to look around for something to do before or after a show at the Blumenthal, It can take forever to get out of the parking garage due to road construction.  Really liked Ri Ra. We were put upstairs, which was very comfortable and a little quieter than downstairs. I had a burger with egg which was great. My wife had salmon, which was also very good. Service was excellent from hostess and server Rachel. Timing was perfect (I cannot stand it when one person gets their food while another person at the table waits). We didn't feel rushed like at some places.  Highly recommended.

Nice place large beer and liquor selection. Service leaves much to be desired and would avoid ordering the food. Fish and Chips at an Irish pub should be pretty standard but was one of the most flavorless things I have consumed
Very quaint and authentic. The beer and dinner were excellent. We loved the atmosphere. Strongly recommended.

If my friend hadn't noticed this place I would never have picked it out. He said "Hey Look, it's an Irish Pub. And I looked at the name and thought I was looking at the wrong place. Have no idea what the name means. Perhaps it is Gaelic. Idk.   But the food.....I can talk about that. Our server appeared shortly after our arrival and took our drink order - Smithwicks for my friend and a perfectly balanced Dark and Stormy for me. Kudos to the bartender for crafting a great cocktail!   My friend ordered the Shepherds Pie and said it was solidly good and not amazing. 3.5 our of 5. For myself I had three small plates - a shaved Brussels Sprouts and Bacon dish that was very nice, Grilled Corn with Limed Butter and finally some Sweet Potato Fries.   All up it was a good meal that I would probably rate as 3.5 except that YELP still does not allow for that (Always hoping!). So I will err on the side of generosity and make that a 4. And I would add - definitely try this place.....

So I'm stuck here for work for a week and found this nice pub.  Not exactly my scene, but the wait staff was super friendly and suggested better spots for me to check out.  Beer selection was pretty typical and drink prices were pretty cheap (considering I live in NY)....Next time i'll try the food!

The food looks great so I'd definitely try it again for lunch or dinner.  But it's a tiny space, even with the upstairs, so don't go on weekends if you don't like being mauled to death by overly tan twenty somethings in polo shirts.

Ri Ra's is right outside of my office ... so my colleagues and I frequent it a few times a month. Their burgers are delicious ... you can't go wrong with the 704, Hot & Smoky, or Guinness BBQ.  Huge burger ... and the side portion is huge too. I always get the onion rings .. one word: DYNAMITE.  A great place to come for lunch, or to come and catch a game on TV.  Very busy bar scene at night also, starting around 10:30/11

I've never been here but heard many great things! We came for Moscow Mules and these are great! It's a great time to hang with friends and drink. I believe they also sell food, so I'll return to sample the cuisine...and have a few mules!

Wow... I am so surprised that this place has been around as long as it has! This used to be one of my regular hang-out spots when I worked in Bank of America's flagship tower around 16 or 17 years ago. Back in those days, this was "the place" to go after work on weekends (and truth be told, many times during the week too, LOL!)   So, recently I was roaming around the area with Tim (who used to frequent Ri-Ra with me many years ago) so we decided to stop in and have a couple of beers and some appetizers for old time's sake.     Man, this place has not changed since we were last here! They even still have bartenders straight from Ireland working the bar, how cool is that?  LOL!   So, the only thing not cool on this visit was the fact that they had the patio closed.  They told us they only open it at certain hours at night... that bummed me out because I really wanted to enjoy my old usual drink (Harp's Lager) outdoors in the sunlight during this visit. Oh well... we still enjoyed the visit.   Even though there are tons of newer spots in the area, I'd probably stop in here again just for old time's sake. And if you have never been, its worth checking out!

Fun place! Good food and drinks. Live band upstairs on the weekends. However the bartender lost my credit card when I went to close it out only to call me the next day to say they found it. Too bad I had already closed my account. Maybe they should get a better system like swiping when you order vs. holding it?

Feel bad giving a one star since we are friends of the bartender and regular customers of Ri-Ras, however we came tonight to visit with Adam and Ray who we come to see every other week we were welcomed with smiles and hugs from Adam who we had come to visit while we were celebrating my sisters 24th birthday night out, we were having a great time and really enjoying ourselves until we asked for the eagles to be played over the house sound system (as they are my sisters favorite band) the bartenders kindly went to the back office and got the eagles playing for us so we could dance and sing and enjoy ourselves until Debby downer the manager marched out from the back and turned the music way down and demanded to know form her staff who had turned the music up with a big grumpy face on her she marched off...the bartenders told us to take no notice and keep on singing, the next song came on and the vol went higher she marched out again and screamed who is messing with the f***ing music and glared at us in the process, she clearly wasn't happy about us trying to enjoy ourselves and made it awkward for everybody..The bartenders apologized and were extremely embarrassed, we closed out as she ruined our night out and left.. it was such a downer for us as we expected to be welcomed more from a Irish pub were we usually have the best time :(
a sports bar galore cold french fries make me so sad eighteen dollars gone

I keep updating my review because I am so pleased with this place! It's my favorite in Charlotte. The food is beyond fresh and so good. Strawberry mojito is the best I have ever had. The most recent time I went I had the salmon and seriously that was the best salmon EVER. I am definitely their biggest fan :))

Upon walking into the bar I was immediately taken aback by the beautiful craftsmanship of the woodwork in the building. The warm and inviting atmosphere makes you feel like you have been transported into Ireland. The quality of Irish Whiskey's and the variety of Irish beers completes the full transformation. Great location, traditional drinks, good place for a great time.   Arguably I only went there for a few drinks, but I had such a great experience I will definitely have to go back to try the food.

Went there for lunch March 19, 2015; they had recently updated their lunch menu. For pedestrian food it is WAY over priced, $12 for a basic hamburger and $14 for a Reuben sandwich. Might be a good place to drink but save your money regarding their food.

Had a few Irish Pub choices in the neighborhood and settled on RiRa.  It was a great choice.  Interior was what you expect in an Irish pub, women's world cup soccer on TV and a great fish and chips meal.  Plus, our waiter Ray is five months removed from Ireland bringing a real Irish flare.   Service was outstanding.   Would recommend highly for a casual night out on the town.

The following things make Ri Ra amazing, no arguments. Period. End of discussion.  1. McSorley's Dark, not only on draft but served in half pints as God intended.  2. Colman's mustard available on request. She brought malt vinegar for my fries, sorry "chips", without me having to ask. Together they are the end all, be all of chip eating.  3. Super tasty and generous food. I loved the beer battered fish and chips and the pork chop with broccolini and potato cake looked (and I'm told was) great.  4. Cragganmore single malt. Yes, it is pricey. A single will run you $12 but it is my favorite scotch, so I say it gets a number.  5. Friendly and jovial staff. We made an open table reservation on a Friday night and though they called to say they couldn't necessarily honor the exact time, when we showed up they had our table waiting despite walk in customers waiting to be seated.  6. Did I say McSorely's and Colman's w/malt vinegar? Because if I did why are we still talking?  Ri Ra is a classy version of the Irish pub I love to feel at home in. Go check it out. It might just save your impression of Uptown.

Ri Ra is pretty decent Irish pub in Uptown: dark wood dining area, Catholic saints and Irish blessings abound, and hearty Irish-inspired dishes on the menu.  It's a great place to get lunch or dinner if you like the Irish pub experience, but don't attempt to get that experience on a weekend night.  You should be warned that the atmosphere changes drastically after the 9 o'clock hour.  The place gets packed on the weekends for the live music, with many young collegiates upstairs looking for potential mates and swarming in unbridled testosterone. Rira's has good cover and local bands, in which case they charge $5-$8 cover.  Don't get wrong, this can be fun in small doses.  Outside of these times, its usually a sedate, older white collar crowd that frequents this place.   Food wise-the burgers are always a good bet and the portions are quite generous.  I've had the sheperd's pie before, it definitely a "stick to your ribs" dinner.  Most entrees are in the $10-$20 range.  The bevvy selection is varied and lean towards British/Irish varieties. The staff are congenial, though hurried on every occasion I've been.  Rira's is a good bet among Uptown restaurants, but nothing that warrants a 5-star review.

Went here for a corporate dinner. Had the finger sandwiches (chicken, pulled pork, and something else), chips and spinach dip, lobster cakes, and potato cakes.   Only tried the pulled pork, which was good, but others said the chicken sandwich disappointed. Lobster and potato cakes could have been better - too salty imo.  Spinach dip the only saving grace. Oh, and their lemon bar dessert.

Here is my quick 2 second review -  Apps are great. Defiantly get the wings (mild and Jameson honey glaze) and the baked spinach dip.  Dinner was just okay - I had the kilcooly. The turkey was a bit dry, there was not much cheddar cheese on the sandwich and the sourdough bread was not that hearty - it kind of tasted like wonder bread. I think if they fixed those couple of little things, it would be outstanding!  Waitress was great! Very friendly and helpful. Went out of her way to make sure we were happy.  Would possibly go back - but just for appetizers and drinks.

Not recommended.. at all  Ordered 2 Guinness and hummus as a appetizer.  She( the waitress)  brought Guinness stew and hummus?!?!? We corrected her and said 2 Guinness beers please. Not stew.  She brought out 1 Guinness. We shared the beer Inhailed the over priced hummus and got the hell out of there.. the 1/2 Guinness I drank was great! Hence the one star!! Shlante!!!

Don't expect to be able to get food or drinks when there for Sunday soccer. I see one waitress for about 100+ people.  I have been there with less people and the same problem. Hour and a half and not once were we able to order food.  Left at halftime to go somewhere else.  Will not return.  If they chose to host the soccer watching things then they should actually hire staff.
Coco loco is now my favorite beer. Drank it while sitting on the rooftop eating the banger appetizer. Covered table with a great view. They had whiskey flights, but not beer. Oh well.
Can't rate the food but we had an excellent time at Ri Ra!  Great service behind the bar on a busy Friday night! Thanks to all!

Definitely a spot for the nightlife crowd as I was not a fan of the food. Boyfriend and I split a sandwich, The Kilcooly. Our group was enjoying each others company while consuming a few tasty local beers but the food took over 45 minutes to come out. If you are an establishment this large you should be able to keep up with the demand. The sandwich itself was terrible, the turkey was dry and the cheese was overcooked. I took two bites and did not want anymore, the fries were okay but I wanted to eat those just to have food on my stomach.   Recommended for shaking your bum on the dance floor, not recommended for food.

I flew in late and wanted a good meal and a beer, so I came stopped here.  Dan, my waiter, was very friendly and responsive.  I got the pot pie and it was great.  The lamb made it.  I tried a local brew and an Irish beer.  Both were delicious.  I will come back next time.

Ive been here before in the past, i don't remember if i enjoyed it or not, but then again that should say everything. Came in on a Saturday night. Not many people in there. We didn't have reservations and was seated upstairs next to the bar of a great big group of people yelling throughout our entire dinner.Eh.  Server seemed not to knowledgeable of the menu as we ordered drinks. Waited a while for them just for him to come back 10 minutes later and say they ran out of the stuff to make my drink. Ok, ordered something else and waited some more.  We ordered the fried crawfish,it was great. I ordered the Ruben and it was big and juicy and everything you would hope a Ruben would be. The Brussel sprouts that i ordered with us was lacking some flavor.  Overall the experience was ok but defiantly forgettable.
I work in Hearst tower so we frequent ri ra for an after work drink. I've also gotten it as take out for lunch - the salmon salad was great. The roof patio is a great spot on a nice warm day!

Wherever I travel it seems I always wind up inside of an Irish pub. Sometimes that is good, and sometimes it can be really bad. In this case, it is good, very good. Ri Rá is a very cozy pub adorned with field stone, vintage Irish signage, and dark wood setting a welcoming tone and making you feel as if you are back in the "old country".  I was also surprised to have a server that was from Ireland take our order, she was of course charming and accommodating, exactly what you would expect. My husband and I popped in to catch a rugby match and the atmosphere was fantastic. They have giant movie screen with surround sound and the place was filled with Irish fans, my husband was thrilled (I wish I could say the same for the outcome of the match!). We ordered a few Guinness, of course... Which were all fresh, tasty, and poured correctly.  My husband had the lamb sliders, with red onion, curried mayo and goat cheese. The mini burgers were deliciously unique and cooked to perfection.  I opted for a chopped salad that had everything you could want, grilled chicken, avocado, tomato, red onion. The salad was lightly dressed and with two rustic slices of brown soda bread and Kerry Gold butter, it was a very generous portion. Very tasty and bonus points for the butter.  Because we were watching the match I decided to finish off the meal with an Irish coffee.  Which can be risky... They actually serve it the correct way!  Coffee, Irish Whiskey (Powers was my choice), sugar and fresh cream. Simple, and delicious!  I will definitely be coming back now that the weather is changing to try some stew and of course another Irish coffee.

Had the shepherds pie. Nice presentation of the dish and ambiance of the pub was wonderful. The pie itself was a bit watery and I was given a fork to eat it with, waitress seemed rushed and a tad forgetful, also no refills ($5 for two glasses of Diet Coke lol). Met some friends here for lunch today. Many wonderful restaurants in Charlotte I would introduce our of town visitors prior to coming back here.

We ate at Ri Ra on 12/12 and really enjoyed it. It's always a guessing game when you pick a restaurant in a strange city. Even with reviews to check out, you never know what you might get. Ri Ra had good solid reviews, however, and was within walking distance of our hotel, which was a deciding factor!  It was fairly busy when we got there and there was a trivia round going, which was slightly annoying, since it echoed through the whole restaurant, but we were there early and once the game ended, it was much better.  We were impressed with the selection of import and local beers. I stuck with Smithwick's but my partner was a little more adventurous and tried several local NC beers, all of which were good.   We started with the hummus appeitzer, expecting the usual bowl of hummus and sliced pita. We were more than pleasantly surprised when what we got was the hummus, toasted pita, and a selection of roasted red peppers, olives, marinated artichokes, and cucumber and celery for dipping. The hummus itself was excellent, garlicky and spicy.   I had the Irish curried chicken over rice and it was quite good. The curry was sweetish, but still had a nice bite to the finish. The chicken was all white meat and nicely tender, and the peppers and onions that were in the curry were delicious.  My partner had the Guinness beef and veggie stew, which was also really good. There was lots of beef in the stew and the Guinness added a really different (and delicious) flavor.   Once the trivia game was over, the atmosphere was great. Music was fun but not too loud for conversation. Our server was friendly and helpful. She made great food and drink suggestions, and even gave us info on places to check out during the rest of our trip.   Ri Ra is definitely a solid 4* and we'll be back the next time we're in Charlotte.

So sad. This used to be a favorite place but it seems a lot has gone downhill since the last time we were there. We went with friends before a concert. We were off to a good start with water, but as soon  as we started ordering actual things, it all went to the dogs. First, the waitress spilled beer all over our friend's leg. 15 minutes later, we hadn't seen her so I asked the hostess for a manager. I had inquired into the bangers and mash, since it was no longer on the menu (How is THAT not on the menu??) but the waitress never told me if it was available or not. The hostess took our order, the manager apologized. Somewhere in there, our appetizers were actually put into the kitchen and were eventually delivered. We ordered more drinks. They took a while but showed up. After an hour, someone came to tell us that our order had been held up because they were out of something for a burger. In the meantime, the table next to us got their food despite having come in 20 minutes after us. They said we didn't miss much because their food was cold. The excuse given was that they had gotten busy.  I get that, but when you are a restaurant in uptown and there is an event, be prepared! By this time we had been there for almost and hour and a half. We decided to pay for our drinks and get something to eat at the venue. There are at least 2 other Irish pubs within a block or so... they will be getting our business next time.

We drove from Harrisburg with reservations and your establishment was dark and locked. My husband has never been to RiRa's and I haven't visited in over 10 years. We reviewed the brunch menu and were pretty excited. Not only did noone answer the phone while we stood outside but we had to pay to park and left without Brunch.

I was fairly unimpressed with my food at Ri Ra... I ordered the lamb burger, which consisted of an under seasoned, overly large portion of ground lamb with a bit of feta on a bun.  Ri Ra redeems itself a bit with a nice pub atmosphere. Although... a more unique selection of Irish brews would be a nice improvement.

I never had the food here, but this is usually our go to spot on weekends.  There is a mix of people and the downstairs and upstairs are like night and day on the weekends.  The downstairs usually has a DJ with people sitting around which is good for mingling.  The upstairs there is usually a live band playing.  There are a bunch of good beers and drinks.  If you get bored work your way to the dance floor to watch a bunch of drunk people who cannot dance worth a damn.  Its a site that needs to be seen.  Also, there is an outside patio upstairs where you can stare directly at other buildings.  This spot is both good for the young and the older.  Its a mix of casual meets semi dressy.

I've been here a few times at this point and it's always fairly good. The food is decent but nothing to rave about and the atmosphere is a good one. I haven't hung out here but from what I understand it's good for the bar experience. I usually go here to dine though as it's convenient to the Belk Theatre. This last visit I had steak tips and potatoes and honestly it wasn't great. The meat had a funny taste to it and the potatoes had no taste to them and some of them had gone bad I think. My grandmother had the fish and chips and she said it was decent. So for what it's worth that was our last experience. I've kind of combined all my trips into this one rating so 3 stars is about all I'd give it.

My wife and I really wanted to like this place - but it's hard when the service is mediocre.  I will say that my food (lamb burger) was excellent.    Our server appeared very disinterested.  The tables near us were getting the same treatment, overhearing comments of "what's her problem?" after she appeared exasperated when she was asked menu questions.  Sure, they were busy, but they weren't packed to the gills (there were open tables).  Mainly, it was the lack of attention.  After our drink and dinner order, our appetizer arrived with our entree - then that was it.  The server saw a few tables near us, but never returned to our table despite our beers being empty for a while.  45 minutes after our food arrived, we finally get to order round #2 - which took 30 minutes to get to us.  For beer.  Several other tables near us were walking to the bar to get their drinks.  Needless to say, I tipped poorly compared to normal.  Probably won't be back - they aren't the only Irish pub in town.

Now THAT was a FISH and chips. It was great. The Mac& Cheese, needs a bit of help with flavor, maybe should have added chicken or something. The Mule and Cider were fantastic. Exactly what you expect from an Irish pub ~ dim lights & dark woods. Great atmosphere.
Great Pub. Staff was awesome and the Jameson was perfect. If your looking for a real Irish Pub, this is the pave your looking for.

I LOVE the Ri Ra.  However, I hate the uptown (parking makes me anxious), so my visits, unfortunately, are too few and too far between.  In 2009 when I read that they had a fire and would be closing down for a bit for renovations, I am fairly certain a tear or two rolled down my cheek.  My arteries opened a lil bit, but I was mildly distraught.  Thank goodness they did the renovation and re-opened!  Recently before an event at Blumenthal, my date and I schlepped it over to the Ri Ra.  After parking at the BoA deck, it was a short walk, and was only a few quick steps away from our final destination of Blumenthal/Belk to see a concert.  Want to sit at the bar?  There are 2 beautiful dark wood bars to park your rump at to slurp down syrupy beers and shots.  High tables with stools?  Got those.  Tables that you can get up and down from without flashing your stuff if you have on a skirt?  Have those too.  2 floors of seating, all dark and lovely, give you plenty of room to pop a squat and enjoy some Irish/bar food at it's finest.  There is even a small terrace/patio upstairs for enjoying Carolina blue days when it is a little warmer out.  My secret dream in life is to find a nice Irish boy to move to the green, green Irish countryside with to spend my days waiting for his liver to pickle/fail.  I LOVE corned beef and cabbage - it's a sickness really.  And while I love to make it, it stinks up the house, so it's always nice to be able to find this delicious dish where it stinks up someone else's kitchen.  The corned beef and cabbage at Ri Ra is delicious.  The corned beef is tender and not terribly stringy.  Well flavored.  the cabbage is... well... cabbage.  Cabbage-y.  Cabbage-ish.  Nothing fancy, just good.  The mashed potatoes that go with are creamy without being runny.  Hearty Irish fair for a green-eyed girl.    For an appetizer, we ordered the Spinach and Artichoke dip which is served with a portion of sliced baguette.  YUM!  Creamy, cheesy, good.  When it hits the table, resist the urge to dig in immediately, or you will be peeling the top layer of skin in your mouth off for the rest of the night.  HOT.  Molten hot.  I previously had the corned beef/cabbage/mashed potato egg rolls, but I didn't see those on the menu.  That was a bummer because they were off the hook good.  I followed the dip with the corned beef and cabbage.  Happy tummy.  We decided to split a dessert and got the peach pie.  That was not a winner.  I don't know where on the pie our slice was, but it was the part with no peaches in it.  I think I accidentally ate one, but I may be mistaken.  Normally I am too full to eat dessert anyway, so this isn't a deal breaker, but I won't be getting that again.  On previous visits I have had the Reuben, which is stuffed with tender corned beef and served with a side. The colcannon side is tasty(mashed potatoes with cabbage mixed in).  The macaroni and cheese is creamy with a crumb topping.  So many things on the menu look delicious, but I almost always stick to my standard Spinach dip and then corned beef and cabbage.    Great bar/restaurant, awesome ambiance and great food!

This review is of their Ri Ra Sandwhich shop around the corner since there is no separate listing for this shop. Stopped here because I've never been before, so I ordered the old faithful Reuben. Pretty hard to screw up, right? Well they managed to serve me a sandwhich that was barely eatable as the corned beef in it was like leather....very hard and chewy. The sandwhich was small. For $9 I'd expect a LOT more. The Rose Sauce wasn't as flavorful as I would expect. Not a very good sandwhich.  Service was iffy at best. The young lady behind the counter was very nice and personable, but the other two seemed like they didn't want to be there...aloof is the appropriate term.  The ONLY saving grace were the Keogh's Dubliner Irish Cheese and Onion Potato Crisps imported from Ireland. If this place is going to rely on packaged potato chips to save them they won't be in business long.  So a SMALL sandwhich, chips and a 20oz bottle of diet coke set me back $14 with tip. That is a LOT for a LESS than adequate sandwhich. I will not be coming back.  NOT recommended!

I came here for "brunch" before having to board a flight home.   I got the Holy Grail Ale and the Breakfast Burger. The ale was tasty and the burger was quite good.  Though I would warn anyone that if you're going to go for this burger make sure your stomach is empty, skip breakfast, go in starving.  This burger is the biggest thing I have ever eaten in one sitting! But, oh my, it was tasty. The kind of clog your arteries good. I don't think I needed to eat again that day.   The only complaint I had was that the service was a little slow for me given I had a flight to catch and mentioned it to my server.

My brother took me and my parents here after a Bobcats game.  It was pretty crowded and my brother and dad had to pay a cover (it was ladies night).  We were able to find a couple of stools together and sat down.  The bartenders were very quick to come over and get our drink orders.  We were also seated close to the live band that was playing, who were awesome by the way.  It is a little smokey inside but I didn't come out smelling of smoke so that was a plus.  Some people had ordered food and it did look pretty tasty.  Next time I will have to get some spinach and artichoke dip which is what the people next to us had.  There are two levels, from what I've heard the upstairs has more of a club atmosphere, needless to say we didn't venture up.  The first floor was great if you ask me.  Live music and good drinks, can't get much better.
always good food, and a great selection of beer that will satisfy
Just stopped in for a quick pint and the selection of beer and whiskey are great and the bartender was friendly.  Kinda confused how a Irish pub does not offer Scotch Eggs though.

not your average Irish pub... on the weekends it can get packed... and upstars they have a DJ or band and it can get a lil crazy... on big nights it is hard to move beacuse of so many pople but i guess it is like that everywhere in CLT... i have never eaten there food... but have heard it is ok...
I had the Cuban chicken sandwich, which was really good. The bread was done just like a Cuban sandwich down in Miami. The sweet potato fries were OK, the dipping sauce was good.

EXCELLENT place in uptown, within easy walking distance of the CATS Lynx Blueline train. Great location, awesome atmosphere, and the food is just incredible. My favorite is the Guinness Beef Stew - tender meat, savory gravy, just perfectly made. It's got an intimate atmosphere, but it's a pub so depending on when you go it can get pretty rowdy. Great staff, definitely a place you should check out!!
Moderate beer choices and decent food. Even though this is a very cookie-cutter Irish pub, not a bad place to kick start your happy hour.
I ordered the stuffed French toast and "won brunch" amongst the group of seven I was with. I highly recommend it. Don't waste your time and calories on anything else!

Went here for dinner. Have been to RiRa in Providence, RI. Ordered fish and chips and short ribs. Ratio of fish to fries left my husband hoping for more fish. Short rib was chewy although flavor was good-- not worth $18. Although I respect and appreciate the fact it was grass fed. Additionally we were seated at a table that was super awkward-- legs made sliding into the booth cumbersome. Decent service. Probably will check out the myriad other places Charlotte has to offer before I'd come back

(Only commenting on Ri Ra as a bar as I have not tried the food) Get some more staff! This place is terribly understaffed, on a Friday night there should not be only 2 bartenders for a packed bar. Easily takes 10 min to get a drink. I like the space and the patio but it means nothing if I can't get a drink.

I've had good times at Ri-Ra, and I've had some bad times. Most of the good times were due to the band playing, which is sometimes really good, and most of the bad times were a combination of bad music and overcrowding.  This place has been a popular mainstay of downtown/uptown as long as I can remember.  It's tall and long inside but very narrow, and when its crowded it can offer up a bit of a claustrophobic vibe.  Since its so popular, it can draw a bit of an unruly, late-night crowd as well. Most of the people here are cool however, and the staff seem to be nice and accommodating.   Still, its hard to get a beer or drink, and I usually don't spend more than an hour or two here before bailing for more comfortable confines.  I can't speak to the food, as I've never eaten here. I have seen a menu though, and it looks decent, and decently priced.

Ri Ra is a typical irish pub with dim lighting, dark wood, plenty of beer and whiskey options and a menu full of specialties like fish and chips and bangers & mash.  Ri Ra has a nice food menu with burgers, salads and appetizers that complement the traditional fair.   I dropped in for a quick bite before a show at Blumenthal the other night.  Service was very quick and friendly.  My friend and I ordered buffalo wings for dinner - each order came with about 10 wings.  They were satisfying, regular wings.   What's  great about Ri Ra is the atmosphere.  It's quite large, but feels cozy and casual.

I just went through the line at the sandwich shop in the courtyard of the Hearst Tower.  The sandwich/ salad makers were polite and fast, and the price was reasonable for downtown.  The salad looks like it could be good, but there is no way for me to know because they were out of utensils.   How can a place that makes salads to go be out of utensils?  And the worst part is that you don't know it until you already through the line and have paid.  They should let people know before they pay.  The guy at the register made no apology or attempt to find some way to provide something to eat with.  Now sitting at my desk with a salad that I can't eat, gotta give it one star for the poor service.

This Ri Ra is one of the better in the chain.  The furnishings are Victorian with splendid chandeliers and lots of dark woods. They have a great patio which does not catch the sun early in the morning, making it perfect for brunch on a warm summer day.  Try the wings.  They have a slight tartness but are also smokey and a little chard.  On our last visit we had brunch- the sausage and egg boxty and Irish Benedict.  Both dishes were suburb, as was the service.  The previous evening, we hung with the upstairs bartender before a concert next door.  Great service there as well   They host an Irish session on Sunday nights-  So happy to see an Irish themed pub making an effort by supporting local Irish musicians.

My friend had Sheppard's Pie and I had a great Burger with Onion Rings, Red Onion, Ri Ra BBQ Sauce and I threw away the bun fo fun and I'm on a diet, so I say.  First we had Potato Cakes and wow they were good.  This is a fun place!  It  exudes Charm and though I would not call it Romantic I do not know why I would not!  We were here last week and wanted to stay, though wound up at Vapiano, so all week I kept thinking when are we going back to Ri Ra, I only took a week.  Few places have such charm that I believe influence my enjoyment of the food.  Ri Ra seems to be one of those places!   Our server, a girl who lived in California was great!  They were staring to play trivia as we were finishing.  We were glad to be finishing!   More on food:  I always enjoy a few bites of a good Shepard's Pie though I would never want more than a few bites!  This one is the best I've tasted 4.0 yelp stars.  My burger  mmmmm 4.1 stars. Ri Ra BBQ Sauce 4.9 stars, Fries (someone loved them) 3.2 stars.  The Bread was a dark, thick, hearty, fresh wonder (looked like Chocolate Cake) 3.89 stars.  Onion Rings 3.2 stars.  Potato Cakes are hard to rate, I've had them in Brit Pubs, Irish Pubs and German Restaurants, these were very good, maybe 4.85 stars or better and they were served with sour cream and balsamic.  Nice Touch!  For dessert we had the very disappointing Special Irish or Baileys Chocolate Mousse and the slightly better Flour less Chocolate cake.  I'll rate the Cake 2.89 yelp stars, I had two bites and though neither of us liked it that much and my friend doesn't even like Chocolate someone cleaned the plate.  This Dessert was after the meal!  I would go back and get the Leak Soup, though it was Soup of the Day and I would check out the Fried pickles and see what else might look good!
This is one of my favorite places to go out, mainly because of the live music. The cover bands do an excellent job, and it's a great place to go out with friends and unwind after a long week of work.

Food was okay - fries overly salty and everything else just eh, nothing worth coming back for. The service was poor (unfriendly and seemed very bothered to even be at work) and with disappointing service and mediocre food, wouldn't come back despite the 20% off coupon from the Carolina History and Haunts tour.

Just average unfortunately.  The good:  My drink...dark and stormy is going to be my new standby.  The mediocre:  Everything else.  Burger was just so so as were the fries.  The burger was the 704...I honestly can't remember if It even came w/ the pickle chips.  The really really low point of the meal was the desert. The bread pudding was ice cold and hard as a rock. It did come smothered with a caramel sauce, but that couldn't save it.  When asked how our food was I was honest and could tell the waiter was taken aback. I mean seriously, don't ask me if you don't wanna know.  I was polite about it, but said that the dessert was just average.  And questioned why it was cold.  Bread pudding is always warm no?  He also got docked a few points for twice trying to take my plate while I still had more then half of my food left.  He actually removed my girlfriend's drink while she was still working on it!    It was nice to have a late night eating option in uptown, but unless someone else wants to go I won't be back.

We stopped in here for a quick bite and a drink before heading over to the Fillmore (in an uber) for a show. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were both extremely friendly and took great care of us. I had the Avocado Smash (no pickled onions). It was delicious, and a perfect light supper for me! My SO had the Reuben. It looked delicious and he crushed it. They have a very decent wine list and a good selection of drafts.   Ri Ra is very close to many hotels and other lively spots, but I would definitely come back again for a casual supper.

This was the most pleasant dining experience I had on my business trip to Charlotte, and of course it occurred the afternoon I was leaving. After spending a week in suburbia hell, I wanted to see if Charlotte actually had a downtown, and happily I found it, along with affordable parking. We were super hungry, so we literally stepped into the first place that served food once we got out of the car. Luckily it was Ri Ra. I hear this is a rocking place on the weekend, but on a cold Tuesday afternoon, we pretty much had the place to ourselves (except for the loudmouth "screenwriter" at the bar). We sat by the fireplace and enjoyed Harp on tap and sandwiches. My pastrami was delicious, but if I could do it again I would have the full serving of the magnificent mac n' cheese. The lunch menu was extensive with very reasonable prices. The best thing about this place however was our waiter, who is getting married in Jackson Square down here in NOLA this August, bless his heart. He was super nice and attentive with zero fakiness. Best of luck to you, kind sir!

Love this place!!! I went on a Monday! Did you know Mondays are half price burger Mondays! The bartenders are the greatest, I had the bacon cheese potatoes and they were great. I will post a picture later, I will definitely be back to try more. Heard on weekend crowd is crazy, not going then but will go on week days when already in uptown.  There was kids that even came in sat in seated area, I sat at bar and watched sports center, did get a little busy but was very much like a dive bar, in a little neighborhood.

Such a cozy pub! We came here as a large group on a Saturday night to celebrate my sister's graduation. The service was very accommodating and quick! Our waitress was actually from Dublin :)  They have a fairly large beer list, a lot of which are on tap. For dinner, I had the Irish breakfast, and it was one of the best I've ever had. The rashers were actual Irish rashers, not the greasy strips of regular bacon you get at a lot of other places. It was a ton of food and for a really great price!  We also got the spinach and artichoke dip as an appetizer. It was super creamy and cheesy- I'd definitely recommend it!

Love this place. The decor and feel of the place is great. However, we came to celebrate an anniversary and it started out great and went downhill quick. The bartender was nice and we are at the bar. I ordered the beef stew but it came out cold. I asked them to reheat it and they did (which took 10 minutes oddly enough) but the mashed potatoes on top were still cold when it returned which makes me think they transferred it from the previous plate. I think I was supposed to get butter with my bread so I asked and they brought out some frozen butter in a tin. What am I supposed to do with that? lol. Anyways, great for drinking but skip the dining experience. I really wanted it to be good because the one in Atlanta was excellent.  Too bad another poor service experience ruined a special occasion. Ri Ra's off the list of places to visit in Charlotte.

Came here for lunch, however I do want to say that I went to the deli next to the Hearst tower. It was super busy though!  Each sandwich is hand made to order and it was not bad. I got the smoked salmon BLT which was actually surprisingly not bad. The prices are a little off to me, but I guess you're in the city maybe that's how it goes. This place is an in and out restaurant.
